intro: Conostylis deplexa, commonly known as the slender conostylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. This species is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The flowers are typically pale blue or white, and the plant is often found in sandy or rocky soils. It is a perennial herb that thrives in coastal and inland regions of Australia.
